properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name_template
properties.description: (Required, string) The basename of the server. A unique name will be generated by the platform.

properties.name: source_server_id
properties.description:
(Required, string) The name or ID of the base OS image.
Examples: "ubuntu-14-64-template", "rhel-7-64-template", "win2012r2dtc-64"

properties.name: group_id
properties.description: (Required, string) The name or ID of the server group to spawn server into.

properties.name: cpu
properties.description: (Required, int) The number of virtual cores

properties.name: memory_mb
properties.description: (Required, int) Provisioned RAM

properties.name: type
properties.description:
(Required, string) The virtualization type
One of "standard", "hyperscale", "bareMetal"

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Optional, string) The root/administrator password. Will be generated by platform if not provided.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional, string) Description for server (visible in control portal only)

properties.name: power_state
properties.description: (Optional, string) See PowerStates below for details. If absent, defaults to started.

properties.name: private_ip_address
properties.description: (Optional, string) Set internal IP address. If absent, allocated and assigned from pool.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description:
(Optional, string) GUID of network to use. (Must be set up in advance from control portal.)
When absent, the default network will be used.

properties.name: storage_type
properties.description:
(Optional, string) Backup and replication strategy for disks.
One of "standard", "premium"

properties.name: aa_policy_id
properties.description: (Optional, string | hyperscale) Anti-Affinity policy ID

properties.name: configuration_id
properties.description: (Optional, string | bareMetal) Hardware configuration ID

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: (Optional, string | bareMetal) Operating system to install.

properties.name: additional_disks
properties.description: (Optional) See Disks below for details.

properties.name: custom_fields
properties.description: (Optional) See CustomFields below for details.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: (Optional) Misc state storage for non-CLC metadata.

properties.name: server-types
properties.description: » Server Types

properties.name: standard
properties.description: » standard
Cloud servers standard offer basic, commodity level performance with mixed spindle/SSD storage profiles. Additional features storage backups, snapshot/clone/archive, and widespread availability.

properties.name: hyperscale
properties.description: » hyperscale
Hyperscale hyperscale servers offer significantly higher IOPS than standard servers for CPU and IO intensive servers. See the FAQ for more details.
Physical host redundancy can be managed via Anti-Affinity policies.

properties.name: baremetal
properties.description: » bareMetal
Bare metal bareMetal offers optimal compute performance and is available in select datacenters in CLC for approved customers. For more info see the FAQ.
For bareMetal, the required fields source_server_id, cpu, and memory_mb are ignored and instead the following fields are required:

properties.name: configuration_id
properties.description: • configuration_id

properties.name: os_type
properties.description: • os_type
Values for configuration_id and os_type are specific to each datacenter and are available via the API endpoints here.

properties.name: powerstates
properties.description: » PowerStates
power_state may be used to set initial power state or modify existing instances.

properties.name: on
properties.description: | started - machine powered on

properties.name: off
properties.description: | stopped - machine powered off forcefully

properties.name: paused
properties.description: freeze machine: memory, processes, billing, monitoring.

properties.name: shutdown
properties.description: shutdown gracefully

properties.name: reboot
properties.description: restart gracefully

properties.name: reset
properties.description: restart forcefully

properties.name: disks
properties.description: » Disks
additional_disks is a block within the configuration that may be repeated to specify the attached disks on a server. Each additional_disks block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required, string) Either "raw" or "partitioned".

properties.name: size_gb
properties.description: (Required, int) Size of allocated disk.

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Required, string, type:partitioned) The mountpoint for the disk.

properties.name: customfields
properties.description: » CustomFields
custom_fields is a block within the configuration that may be repeated to bind custom fields for a server. CustomFields need be set up in advance. Each custom_fields block supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required, string) The ID of the custom field to set.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required, string) The value for the specified field.

properties.name: packages
properties.description: » Packages

packages is a block within the configuration that may be repeated to specify packages and their associated parameters to be run at instantiation. Packages facilitate various tasks like ssh key installation, kernel upgrades, etc. Package ID as well as parameters are configured via this block.
Example:

# Configure the CLC Provider
provider "clc_server" "ubuntu" {
  # ...
  packages {
    id     = "77abb844-579d-478d-3955-c69ab4a7ba1a"
    SshKey = "ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAA..."
  }
}
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name (or GUID) of this server group. Will resolve to existing if present.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: (Required, string) The name or ID of the parent group. Will error if absent or unable to resolve.

properties.name: location_id
properties.description:
(Required, string) The datacenter location of both parent group and this group.
Examples: "WA1", "VA1"

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional, string) Description for server group (visible in control portal only)

properties.name: custom_fields
properties.description: (Optional) See CustomFields below for details.

properties.name: customfields
properties.description: » CustomFields
custom_fields is a block within the configuration that may be repeated to bind custom fields for a server. CustomFields need be set up in advance. Each custom_fields block supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required, string) The ID of the custom field to set.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required, string) The value for the specified field.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: server_id
properties.description: (Required, string) The name or ID of the server to bind IP to.

properties.name: internal_ip_address
properties.description:
(Required, string) The internal IP of the
NIC to attach to. If not provided, a new internal NIC will be
provisioned and used.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: (Optional) See Ports below for details.

properties.name: source_restrictions
properties.description: (Optional) See SourceRestrictions below for details.

properties.name: ports-1
properties.description: » Ports
ports is a block within the configuration that may be repeated to specify open ports on the target IP. Each ports block supports the following:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required, string) One of "tcp", "udp", "icmp".

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required, int) The port to open. If defining a range, demarks starting port

properties.name: portTo
properties.description: (Optional, int) Given a port range, demarks the ending port.

properties.name: sourcerestrictions
properties.description: » SourceRestrictions
source_restrictions is a block within the configuration that may be repeated to restrict ingress traffic on specified CIDR blocks. Each source_restrictions block supports the following:

properties.name: cidr
properties.description: (Required, string) The IP or range of IPs in CIDR notation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required, string) The name of the load balancer.

properties.name: data_center
properties.description: (Required, string) The datacenter location of both parent group and this group.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Required, string) Either "enabled" or "disabled"

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional, string) Description for server group (visible in control portal only)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: load_balancer
properties.description: (Required, string) The id of the load balancer.

properties.name: data_center
properties.description: (Required, string) The datacenter location for this pool.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required, int) Either 80 or 443

properties.name: method
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The configured balancing method. Either
"roundRobin" (default) or "leastConnection".

properties.name: persistence
properties.description:
(Optional, string) The configured persistence
method. Either "standard" (default) or "sticky".
• nodes - (Optional) See Nodes below for details.

properties.name: nodes
properties.description: » Nodes
nodes is a block within the configuration that may be repeated to specify connected nodes on this pool. Each nodes block supports the following:

properties.name: ipAddress
properties.description: (Required, string) The destination internal ip of pool node.

properties.name: privatePort
properties.description: (Required, int) The destination port on the pool node.

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Optional, string) Either "enabled" or "disabled".
